jbb.engine
Class Tile

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.AbstractButton
                  javax.swing.JButton
                      jbb.engine.Tile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
Avatar, Item, Wall
public class Tile
extends javax.swing.JButton

The Tile class has a position and an image. All squares on the board will be instances of Tile or one of its subclasses. The tile will either be blank or hold an image.

Author:
Bruno Colantonio, Boris Ionine
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Tile

public Tile(Position position,
            Board board)
The constructor will create a Tile at the positions of the row and column. The image of a standard Tile is white.

Parameters:
position - will set the position of the Tile
board - will set the Tile to the specified board

                 throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
The method will set the position to the parameter given. Throws an exception if the position given is out of bounds.

public javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage()
The method will return the image used on the tile.

the image used on the tile.

The method will set the image on the tile.

Parameters:

getAccessible

public boolean getAccessible()
Returns:
true if Tile is generally accessible

setAccessible

public void setAccessible(boolean accessible)
The method will make the tile accessible

Parameters:
accessible - Set whether the tile is accessible by the Avatars or not.

getAdjacentTiles

public Tile[] getAdjacentTiles()
The method will return an array to show the tiles surrounding the current tile. The indexes of the the array correspond to the constants defined at the top of class. Adjacent squares that are out of the bounds of the board will be set to null.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
